txt.en: 'Our time ashore, always brief, allowed for little adventure. I did not desire adventure in those days; only camaraderie. The Captain - who had taken a liking to me only a few years ago in a tavern - and I became dearest friendsâ€¦.'
After hearing how the captain and the mariner grew close it is time to speak with the mariner once again.
'Our future was not set, but I knew I had earned the respect of a man whom I greatly respected. When we set back to sail, I was named his second.'
There is more to Falnavar's tale and he would like to share it with you. He speaks fondly of his past.
There is no twist in this mission.
There is more still to the mariner's tale. He bids you listen to the story of how he and the captain became fast friends.
